TopicTitle: Video Wednesdays: A 2-year-old Playing Kerbal Space Program

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="http://media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_mwl9tb0Vd31rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>****** <iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/fpmi1JdfXpE" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Today’s video comes from <strong>Youtube</strong> user, <strong>gkcopperdrag</strong>, who uploaded a time-lapse video of their intelligent 2-year-old son playing <em><strong>KSP</strong></em>. It’s both adorable and incredible to watch. Enjoy!</p>

Holy crud, that's amazing! I don't know how to explain this, but feels were had when he solved his staging problem after the first flight. He reminds me of when I first played KSP, except older and was worse than he is.

This kid's going big, I'll tell ya that.
Wow, he's younger than the game itself and within the first few minutes hes already got a rocket built and staging... adorable though
Very precocious (and adorable ). Here's to hoping he has a wonderful childhood full of dreams of space.
Scott Manley, you got pwnt by a 2-year-old. But I do say, he does not quite possess the efficient hairstyle you do.
Yup. This little dude is better than my two nephews 9 and 12 years old when it comes to launching rockets. Bummer
I hope he grows to take us to space some day. (by the way anyone knows what was that music, reminded me a little of the cinematic orchesta)

HAHA he forgot to put a thruster on the last stage! NOOB!

(kidding, of course )
Ah. I see how bad I truly am now...

[Deleted by user]

Edited November 25, 2019 by Guest

I hope he keeps on playing kebal.
I think he looks like he's at lest one year older than two. Impressive nonetheless.

That is really amazing!

I hope he grows to take us to space some day. (by the way anyone knows what was that music, reminded me a little of the cinematic orchesta)
It sounds to me like Brian Eno's An Ending (Ascent). [WikiPedia] [Pandora]

Mini-Jeb! He's pretty smart though.

He'll become the new Scott Manley before the age of 5.
